java/liquibase/change/DropUniqueConstraintChange.java

00001 package liquibase.change;
00002 
00003 import liquibase.database.Database;
00004 import liquibase.database.SQLiteDatabase;
00005 import liquibase.database.SQLiteDatabase.AlterTableVisitor;
00006 import liquibase.database.sql.DropUniqueConstraintStatement;
00007 import liquibase.database.sql.SqlStatement;
00008 import liquibase.database.structure.DatabaseObject;
00009 import liquibase.database.structure.Index;
00010 import liquibase.database.structure.Table;
00011 import liquibase.exception.JDBCException;
00012 import liquibase.exception.UnsupportedChangeException;
00013 import liquibase.exception.InvalidChangeDefinitionException;
00014 import liquibase.util.StringUtils;
00015 import org.w3c.dom.Document;
00016 import org.w3c.dom.Element;
00017 
00018 import java.util.ArrayList;
00019 import java.util.HashSet;
00020 import java.util.List;
00021 import java.util.Set;
00022 
00026 public class DropUniqueConstraintChange extends AbstractChange {
00027     private String schemaName;
00028     private String tableName;
00029     private String constraintName;
00030 
00031     public DropUniqueConstraintChange() {
00032         super("dropUniqueConstraint", "Drop Unique Constraint");
00033     }
00034 
00035     public String getSchemaName() {
00036         return schemaName;
00037     }
00038 
00039     public void setSchemaName(String schemaName) {
00040         this.schemaName = StringUtils.trimToNull(schemaName);
00041     }
00042 
00043     public String getTableName() {
00044         return tableName;
00045     }
00046 
00047     public void setTableName(String tableName) {
00048         this.tableName = tableName;
00049     }
00050 
00051     public String getConstraintName() {
00052         return constraintName;
00053     }
00054 
00055     public void setConstraintName(String constraintName) {
00056         this.constraintName = constraintName;
00057     }
00058 
00059     public void validate(Database database) throws InvalidChangeDefinitionException {
00060         if (StringUtils.trimToNull(constraintName) == null) {
00061             throw new InvalidChangeDefinitionException("constraintName is required", this);
00062         }
00063 
00064     }
00065 
00066     public SqlStatement[] generateStatements(Database database) throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00067         
00068         if (database instanceof SQLiteDatabase) {
00069                 // return special statements for SQLite databases
00070                 return generateStatementsForSQLiteDatabase(database);
00071         }
00072         
00073         return new SqlStatement[]{
00074                 new DropUniqueConstraintStatement(getSchemaName() == null?database.getDefaultSchemaName():getSchemaName(), getTableName(), getConstraintName()),
00075         };
00076     }
00077     
00078     private SqlStatement[] generateStatementsForSQLiteDatabase(Database database) 
00079                         throws UnsupportedChangeException {
00080         
00081         // SQLite does not support this ALTER TABLE operation until now.
00082                 // For more information see: http://www.sqlite.org/omitted.html.
00083                 // This is a small work around...
00084         
00085         // Note: The attribute "constraintName" is used to pass the column 
00086         // name instead of the constraint name.
00087         
00088         List<SqlStatement> statements = new ArrayList<SqlStatement>();
00089         
00090                 // define alter table logic
00091                 AlterTableVisitor rename_alter_visitor = new AlterTableVisitor() {
00092                         public ColumnConfig[] getColumnsToAdd() {
00093                                 return new ColumnConfig[0];
00094                         }
00095                         public boolean copyThisColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00096                                 return true;
00097                         }
00098                         public boolean createThisColumn(ColumnConfig column) {
00099                                 if (column.getName().equals(getConstraintName())) {
00100                                 column.getConstraints().setUnique(false);                                               
00101                         }                                       
00102                                 return true;
00103                         }
00104                         public boolean createThisIndex(Index index) {
00105                                 return true;
00106                         }
00107                 };
00108                 
00109         try {
00110                 // alter table
00111                         statements.addAll(SQLiteDatabase.getAlterTableStatements(
00112                                         rename_alter_visitor,
00113                                         database,getSchemaName(),getTableName()));
00114         } catch (JDBCException e) {
00115                         e.printStackTrace();
00116                 }
00117         
00118         return statements.toArray(new SqlStatement[statements.size()]);
00119     }
00120 
00121     public String getConfirmationMessage() {
00122         return "Unique constraint "+getConstraintName()+" dropped from "+getTableName();
00123     }
00124 
00125     public Element createNode(Document currentChangeLogFileDOM) {
00126         Element node = currentChangeLogFileDOM.createElement(getTagName());
00127         if (getSchemaName() != null) {
00128             node.setAttribute("schemaName", getSchemaName());
00129         }
00130         
00131         node.setAttribute("tableName", getTableName());
00132         node.setAttribute("constraintName", constraintName);
00133         return node;
00134     }
00135 
00136     public Set<DatabaseObject> getAffectedDatabaseObjects() {
00137 
00138         Set<DatabaseObject> returnSet = new HashSet<DatabaseObject>();
00139 
00140         Table table = new Table(getTableName());
00141         returnSet.add(table);
00142 
00143         return returnSet;
00144 
00145     }
00146 }
